full_text: iy Geis 1 och cor os Son Be es IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT BERNAKULAM 2018/KER/S02 PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA FRIDAY, THE 5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 15TH POUSHA, 1939 Cr1.MC.No. 8455 of 2017 CRIME NO. 714/2014 OF TIRUR POLICE STATION , MALAPPURAM PETITIONER/1ST ACCUSED ABDUL SALAM PALAKKAVALAPPIL, s/o. ABDULLAKUTTY, AGED 33 YEARS, PALAKKAVALAPPIL HOUSE, PACHATHIRI, TIRUR - 676 105, MALAPPURAM DISTRICT. BY ADV.SRI. K.K.MOHAMED RAVUF RESPONDENT /COMPLAINANT STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI. ALEX M. THOMBRA. THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: iy Geis 1 och cor os eS el, 2018/KER/502 Cr1.MC.No. 8455 of 2017 APPENDIX PETITIONER (S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE Al TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO. 714/2014 OF TIRUR POLICE STATION, MALAPPURAM. ANNEXURE A2 TRUE COPY OF THE LETTER NO. D1/67977/13 MM DATED 25.04.2014 OF DISTRICT POLICE CHIEF, MALAPPURAM. ANNEXURE A3 TRUE COPY OF THE ORDER DATED 08.11.2016 IN CRL.M.C.NO. 1634/2016 OF THIS HON'BLE COURT. ANNEXURE A4 TRUE COPY OF THE ORDER DATED 06.04.2016 IN CRL.M.C.NO.2035/2016 OF THIS HON'BLE COURT. RESPONDENT (S)' EXHIBITS NIL // TRUE COPY// P.S TO JUDGE. Hr... nl 2018/KER/502 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. veneeneee CTEM, NO-8455 Of 2047 Dated this the 5 day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioner is the 1% accused in Crime No.714/2014 of Tirur Police Station for the offences punishable under Sections 464, 465 and 471 read with Section 34 IPC and Section 12B of the Passports Act, 1967. lt is alleged that the petitioner had consented to his brother, who is the 2 accused, to acquire a passport by using the name and address of the petitioner. 2. According to the petitioner, his brother had made the mischief by showing the name and address of the petitioner for acquiring a passport. Annexure-A2 letter of the District Police Chief, Malappuram, clearly shows that the enquiry conducted revealed that the brother of the petitioner had earlier obtained an Indian passport E2658676 impersonating him as the petitioner and performed journey Bear 2018/KER/502 Crl.M.C.8455/2017 :2: abroad. When the said fact have come to light, the petitioner cannot be an accused in the crime. 3. The registration of the crime as against the petitioner is not legally sustainable and all further proceedings against the petitioner in Crime No.714/2014 of Tirur Police Station are liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A1 First Information Report in Crime No.714/2014 of Tirur Police Station and all further proceedings as against the petitioner in it, are quashed. Sd/- (B-KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/05/01 1 True Copy // PS to Judge
